entry.title: Azerbaijan again blocks Red Cross from Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan again blocks Red Cross from Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
üìçAzerbaijan again blocked International Red Cross vehicles from transporting critically ill patients from Nagorno-Karabakh to Armenia. üìçThe ruling Civil Contract party removed Taguhi Tovmasyan, the last remaining opposition lawmaker with a leadership position in parliament, as head of the legislature‚Äôs human rights committee.

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs Education System: From Crisis To Solutions

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs Education System: From Crisis To Solutions
media:group.media:description:
Tamara Babaian, professor of computer information systems at Bentley University in Massachusetts, sat down with CivilNet on the sidelines of the Armenian Society of Fellows conference which was held last week in Dilijan, Armenia. Babaian discusses how her education in Armenia prepared her for a career in the west, why education reform is key to advancing the science and technology sectors, and the importance of collaboration between Armenian and foreign educational institutions.

entry.title: Is Russia an irreplaceable ally for Armenia?

media:group.media:title: Is Russia an irreplaceable ally for Armenia?
media:group.media:description:
CivilNet‚Äôs Karen Harutyunyan talked to Ronald Grigor Suny, a renowned professor of Soviet and Russian history and a participant in an international symposium on Russia organized by the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey in Tsaghkadzor, Armenia on July 7-12, 2023.
Ronald Grigor Suny is a distinguished University Professor of History and Professor of Political Science Emeritus at the University of Michigan and Emeritus Professor of Political Science and History at the University of Chicago.

entry.title: Tourism in bordering Goris thrives despite obstacles

media:group.media:title: Tourism in bordering Goris thrives despite obstacles
media:group.media:description:
Join us on a journey to Goris, a picturesque town nestled in the heart of Syunik Armenia. In this video, we visit Marietta, the owner of Aregak B&B, one of the many charming accommodations in the region. Despite border conflicts and travel warnings, Marietta tells CivilNet how she manages to keep a thriving operation and attract guests from all over the world.

entry.title: Karabakh again left without natural gas after Azerbaijan briefly restores supply

media:group.media:title: Karabakh again left without natural gas after Azerbaijan briefly restores supply
media:group.media:description:
üìçAzerbaijani forces again opened fire at a multimillion-dollar metallurgical plant under construction in the Armenian border village of Yeraskh. üìçAzerbaijan briefly allowed natural gas to flow to Nagorno-Karabakh before again cutting the region‚Äôs gas supply just hours later. üìçA United Nations court reaffirmed its decision ordering Azerbaijan to lift its blockade of Nagorno-Karabakh. üìçTwo captured Armenian soldiers were sentenced to more than 11 years in prison in Azerbaijan after a short trial.

entry.title: Transformative impact in Armenia‚Äôs education and research sectors

media:group.media:title: Transformative impact in Armenia‚Äôs education and research sectors
media:group.media:description:
Vatche Sahakian, professor of theoretical physics at the Harvey Mudd college in California, sits down with CivilNet to discuss the projects which have been kickstarted at the Armenian Society of Fellows. The Fellows conference, which aims to find concrete solutions to advance Armenia‚Äôs education and research sector, took place last week in Dilijan, Armenia.
Sahakian explains four projects which have now moved to the implementation phase, and how the society aims to transform Armenia‚Äôs educational and research spheres.

entry.title: The evolution of Russia‚Äôs relations with the West: A conversation with Hanna Notte

media:group.media:title: The evolution of Russia‚Äôs relations with the West: A conversation with Hanna Notte
media:group.media:description:
CivilNet‚Äôs Karen Harutyunyan talked to Hanna Notte, an expert on Russian foreign and security policy and a participant in an international symposium on Russia organized by the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey in Tsaghkadzor, Armenia on July 7-12, 2023.
Hanna Notte is a Senior Research Associate at the Vienna Center for Disarmament and Non-Proliferation and a Senior Associate (non-resident) in the Europe, Russia, and Eurasia Program at the Center for Strategic & International Studies in Washington, D.C.
